example.text: We also report the existence of isoforms of NF-YA which results from differential splicing.
example.arg: differential splicing
the existence of isoforms of NF-YA

example.text: Both the 5 and 3 splice site mutations (1060 + 2t-->c and 678-7g-->a, respectively) result in high proportions of mature mRNAs containing introns, which has not been observed for other splicing mutations.
example.arg: Both the 5 and 3 splice site mutations
high proportions of mature mRNAs containing introns

example.text: Sequence analysis of the IDHbeta gene indicates that the difference in the C-terminal 28 amino acids between beta(1) and beta(2) proteins results from alternative splicing of a single transcript.
example.arg: alternative splicing of a single transcript
the difference in the C-terminal 28 amino acids between beta(1) and beta(2) proteins

example.text: Alternative splicing of exon 2 (139 nt) and alternative transcriptional initiation result in mRNA species with distinct 5UTRs.
example.arg: Alternative splicing of exon 2 (139 nt) and alternative transcriptional initiation
mRNA species with distinct 5UTRs

example.text: Two are missense mutations in exon 2 (G339D and R340C), and the other three alterations (a nonsense mutation, a frameshift, and a splicing mutation) are likely to result in truncated nonfunctional proteins.
example.arg: the other three alterations
truncated nonfunctional proteins

example.text: Expression of isoform II cDNA in COS7 cells resulted in a marked increase in PAF acetylhydrolase activity.
example.arg: Expression of isoform II cDNA in COS7 cells
a marked increase in PAF acetylhydrolase activity

example.text: Human mucin gene MUC5B, the 10.7-kb large central exon encodes various alternate subdomains resulting in a super-repeat.
example.arg: various alternate subdomains
a super-repeat

example.text: The change may cause the heat instability and affect the net charge of the variant subunit, resulting in an electrophoretic LDH-B subunit variant of the fast type.
example.arg: the net charge of the variant subunit
an electrophoretic LDH-B subunit variant of the fast type

example.text: Complete sequencing of the prion protein open reading frame of a 68-year-old woman affected by a familial form of Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease (CJD) revealed a new mutation at codon 210 resulting in the substitution of isoleucine for valine.
example.arg: a new mutation at codon 210
the substitution of isoleucine for valine

example.text: Exon 13 skipping in s1031 animals results in a 543 bp product.
example.arg: Exon 13 skipping in s1031 animals
a 543 bp product

example.text: This result also supports our interpretation that let-341 (s1031) represents a loss-of-function rather a severe reduction-of-function mutation, because we expect that fluctuation in the ras-dependent signaling caused by a sli-1 mutation would result in a dramatic change in vulval induction under the condition where a low level activity of LET-23/SEM-5/SOS-1 is present (C.Yoon, C.Chang and P.Sternberg, unpublished).
example.arg: fluctuation in the ras-dependent signaling
a dramatic change in vulval induction under the condition where a low level activity of LET-23/SEM-5/SOS-1 is present

example.text: A role for SOS-1 in FGFR-mediated signaling during development Hyperactive EGL-15 FGF receptor signaling, conferred by either an activated egl-15 or a lf clr-1 mutation, results in a Clr phenotype.
example.arg: A role for SOS-1 in FGFR-mediated signaling during development Hyperactive EGL-15 FGF receptor signaling
a Clr phenotype

example.text: Decreased EGL-15 signaling, conferred by a partial lf egl-15 mutation, results in a scrawny body morphology phenotype(Kokel et al., 1998).
example.arg: Decreased EGL-15 signaling
a scrawny body morphology phenotype

example.text: One variant results from failure to use the normal splice donor site of intron 12.
example.arg: failure to use the normal splice donor site of intron 12
One variant
